![hello-world](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

# What is the `Hello World` program?

- A "Hello, World!" program is a simple computer program that displays "Hello, World!" to the user.[^1]
- It's often the first program written by students learning a new programming language. It can also be used to ensure that the computer software is correctly installed and that the operator knows how to use it.[^2]

[^1]: https://press.rebus.community/programmingfundamentals/chapter/hello-world/
[^2]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%22Hello,_World!%22_program

{% /slide %}

{% slide %}

# Hello HTML

`Hello, World` can also be written on a web page using HTML.
Here's some code that displays "Hello, World!" on a web page:[^3]

```html
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Hello World Example</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <h1>Hello World!</h1>
  </body>
</html>
```

[^3]: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-code-to-display-hello-world-on-the-web-page

{% /slide %}
